name: drumhead
content:
drumhead noun
(ON DRUM)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C ]
  music
  specialized the piece of thin material that is stretched across a drum and hit to make a sound: The bongos are traditionally played by striking the drumheads with the fingers and palms. He had the band's name printed across his bass drumhead.
More examplesFewer examplesShe brought some goat-hide drumheads back from Haiti.The cloth was stretched as tight as a drumhead.

drumhead noun
(VEGETABLE)
[ C or U ] (also drumhead cabbage) a type of bright green or dark red cabbage (= a large, round vegetable) that has a round, solid shape with many leaves growing very close together: Red drumhead is a very reliable red cabbage that can be grown as a summer or autumn/winter cabbage. They grow big Dutch drumheads. Drumhead cabbage heads are rounded in shape and composed of tightly packed, bright green leaves with a refreshing, peppery flavour.
More examplesFewer examplesHe grows purple carrots, drumhead and Savoy cabbages, and purple-sprouting broccoli.

history
  specialized used for referring to a trial, especially a military trial, that is carried out quickly and often not fairly or correctly: He was handed over to the British and shot after a drumhead court martial that lasted less than two hours. Internment, torture, and drumhead tribunals were all given specious justifications.
More examplesFewer examplesMany militia officers were murdered, and many militiamen were executed by drumhead court martial.An officers' drumhead court condemned him to death.It seemed very unfair to have proved my innocence, and now to face a kind of drumhead court martial as though I were guilty.
